intro: Piper triquetrobaccum, commonly known as the three-lobed pepper plant, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which have three distinct lobes, and its small, clustered flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when mature. The botanical features of Piper triquetrobaccum make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
